content:
If anyone's interested, there's a brand new contrib module available that can set different frontpages per language. Testing and feedback is welcome.

I think, it fills another internationalization gap, as different start (home, front) pages per language are a common task, even if there's no need for a fully blown internationalized site.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/frontpage_multilingual

backdrop-contrib/frontpage_multilingual
Backdrop CMS multilingual module to set the frontpage per language - backdrop-contrib/frontpage_multilingual
Thanks for putting that module together @indigoxela :pray: ...was that task handled by i18n or core in Drupal? ...or was it not handled at all?

was that task handled by i18n or core in Drupal?

That has been handled by i18n_variables submodule, but that's not possible anymore. And in i18n it was complicated with an awful UI. Hopefully it's easier to understand and configure with that module. :fingers_crossed:
So great to see i18n moving forward, thank you @indigoxela
Interesting to see this lean approach as alternative to both core and the i18n module!
